column1: TDSNN: From Deep Neural Networks to Deep Spike Neural Networks with Temporal-Coding
Lei Zhang@Institute of Computing Technology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences
column2: Shengyuan Zhou@University of Chinese Academy of Sciences
column3: Tian Zhi@Institute of Computing Technology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences
column4: Zidong Du@Institute of Computing Technology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences

column1: Continuous-valued deep convolutional networks (DNNs) can be converted into accurate rate-coding based spike neural networks (SNNs). However
column2: the substantial computational and energy costs
column3: which is caused by multiple spikes
column4: limit their use in mobile and embedded applications. And recent works have shown that the newly emerged temporal-coding based SNNs converted from DNNs can reduce the computational load effectively. In this paper
column5: we propose a novel method to convert DNNs to temporal-coding SNNs
column6: called TDSNN. Combined with the characteristic of the leaky integrate-andfire (LIF) neural model
column7: we put forward a new coding principle Reverse Coding and design a novel Ticking Neuron mechanism. According to our evaluation
column8: our proposed method achieves 42% total operations reduction on average in large networks comparing with DNNs with no more than 0.5% accuracy loss. The evaluation shows that TDSNN may prove to be one of the key enablers to make the adoption of SNNs widespread.
